DOC.brief_summary: The early assessment of new symptomatic drugs for Alzheimer disease remains difficult because of the lack of predictive end-point. The use of a battery including different parameters could improve this early development. In healthy volunteers, to test the reverse effect of symptomatic drugs, it is necessary to induce transient and reversible cognitive impairment and cerebral activity changes by a challenge test. In this context, a transient hypoxia could be relevant.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Hypoxia on Cognitive Assessment and Cerebral Activity in Healthy Volunteers
